page.title: 04Housing, Swainby & Potto
page.content: {Swainby}has no large-scale develop- ment, the two small housing estates being discreetly sited behind and west of the main street.National Park rules apply to design and materials used in the Conservation Area but there are some inconsistencies. Of the 6 Council Houses,4 have been sold to the tenants and there are 23 OAP bungalows with resident warden. Most of the older houses have been modernised, some being originally miners' cottages built when the ironstone mines were in production. In{Potto,}post-war houses outnumber older ones. An estate of 13 houses was built in the 1960s, west of the main street, where there has been infilling. Potto Hall, a Victorian mansion, is now a hotel. There are 3 public houses in Swainby, 1 in Potto and 2 in Trenholme.{Ingleby Arncliffe} has a new housing estate.
